sn36.15:1.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha … sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn36.15:1.2: “Sir, what is feeling? What’s the origin of feeling? What’s the cessation of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling?
sn36.15:1.3: And what is feeling’s gratification, drawback, and escape?”
sn36.15:1.9: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn36.15:1.10: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn36.15:1.11: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling: this is its gratification.
sn36.15:1.12: That feeling is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
sn36.15:1.13: Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape.
sn36.15:1.14: But I have also explained the progressive cessation of conditions.
sn36.15:1.15: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has ceased. …
sn36.15:1.16: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.
sn36.15:1.17: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have ceased.
sn36.15:1.18: And I have also explained the progressive stilling of conditions.
sn36.15:1.19: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has stilled. …
sn36.15:1.20: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have stilled.
sn36.15:1.21: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have stilled.
sn36.15:1.22: And I have also explained the progressive tranquilizing of conditions.
sn36.15:1.23: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has been tranquilized. …
sn36.15:1.24: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite space, the perception of form has been tranquilized.
sn36.15:1.25: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite consciousness, the perception of the dimension of infinite space has been tranquilized.
sn36.15:1.26: For someone who has attained the dimension of nothingness, the perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness has been tranquilized.
sn36.15:1.27: For someone who has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, the perception of the dimension of nothingness has been tranquilized.
sn36.15:1.28: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have been tranquilized.
sn36.15:1.29: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have been tranquilized.”
